result.execSummary:
The defendant Emilio Venegas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by the defendant's prison funds at a percentage to determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Provide a DNA sample
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court GRANTS expungement upon successful completion of probation.
Comply with any vocational and/or educational recommendations.
AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emilio Venegas

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 13 pages) commencing 05-06-2022 by Danielle N. Holcomb.
Filed: Original Transcript of Bench Warrant ( 3 pages) commencing 04-04-2022 by Katherine M. Nelson.
Filed: Original Transcript of Return on Warrant (4 pages) commencing April 6, 2022 by Amy De La Rosa.
Filed: Original Transcript of Initial Appearance ( 9 pages) commencing 03-19-2022 by Jennifer L. Carter.
Received and Filed.
received and filed.
for Attorney Brett Copeland, received and filed
Defendant's Notice of Intent to Seek Postconviction Relief

Defendant Emilio Venegas in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS, with 6 DAYS credit. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 18 MONTHS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Serve 10 MONTHS condition time in the House of Correction; Report no later than 07/14/2022 by 5:00 pm.
- Court authorizes Huber release for work and education purposes.
- Provide a DNA sample. 
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Comply with any vocational and/or educational recommendations 

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

*Court GRANTS expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights

JusticePoint Discharge Report dated June 28, 2022 - received
Court will address with the parties on the next court date

Defendant Emilio Venegas in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 25.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Emilio Venegas in court with Attorney Brett Lee Copeland. Both appear by video.  Navjot Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Langer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Court advise Defendant to contact Justice Point after today's hearing. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Violation Report dated May 5, 2022 - received

JusticePoint Violation Report dated May 2, 2022 - received
Court will review
All previous bail conditions remain in full force and effect.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Emilio Venegas in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court return on warrant.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. SPD still need to appoint counsel on this case.   Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Emilio Venegas not in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
JusticePoint Supervision Report dated April 1, 2022 - received

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving during pendency of case.

Defendant Emilio Venegas in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Emilio Venegas in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Emilio Venegas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
